definition[0]: a raised circular area where three or more roads join together and which cars must drive around
example[0]: Turn left at the first roundabout.
definition[1]: a round structure for children to play on in a park. Children sit on it while someone pushes it around and around.
definition[3]: a roundabout way of saying something is not clear, direct, or simple
example[1]: It was a roundabout way of telling us to leave.
definition[4]: a roundabout way of getting somewhere is longer and more complicated than necessary
example[2]: The bus took a very long and roundabout route.
